titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tom Burrell papers, 1949-2016 and undated RL.11678
titlestmt.author: Katarzyna Stempniak, Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-25 16:33:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Thomas J. Burrell is a Chicago-based advertising executive who started his own advertising agency, Burrell Communications, in 1971. Collection includes clippings, correspondence, texts of presentations, research reports, print advertisements, commercial scripts and storyboards and other printed materials as well as slides, photographs and audiovisual items (videocassettes, optical discs). Professional files reflect Burrell's specialization in advertising to African American and other minority consumer groups and the firm's approach to multicultural marketing. Materials also relate to Burrell's student years as well as notes and drafts of his book, Brainwashed: Challenging the Myth of Black Inferiority and Burrell's nonprofit organization The Resolutions Project. Companies represented include Bell Atlantic, Brown-Forman (Bacardi, Canadian Mist, Jack Daniels), Coca-Cola (including Sprite), K-Mart, McDonald's, Mobil, Philip Morris (Marlboro), Polaroid, Procter & Gamble (Tide, Gain, Crest, others) and Sears. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Client Files; General Files; Presentations and Speeches; Book Files; Personal Files; Audiovisual Materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas J. Burrell is a Chicago-based advertising executive who started his own advertising agency, Burrell Communications, in 1971.

Born 1939, Chicago; BA English, Roosevelt University 1962; copywriter: Wade Advertising 1960-1964, Leo Burnett 1964-1967, Foote Cone Belding 1967-1968; copy supervisor, Needham Harper Steers 1968-1971; cofounded Burrell McBain agency 1971 with Emmett McBain (change to Burrell Communications 1974); merger with Publicis 2000; Albert Lasker lifetime achievement award 1986; AAF Hall of Fame 2005; published Brainwashed 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. However, original audiovisual materials are closed until use copies can be produced.
Materials may be stored in an offsite facility. Please allow two business days for retrieval. Contact Research Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Tom Burrell papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Tom Burrell papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0136, 2018-0143

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
African American history marketing and promotional posters;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Competitive advertisements;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Corporation Vertical Files;
J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Research Department Records

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes clippings, correspondence, texts of presentations, research reports, print advertisements, commercial scripts and storyboards and other printed materials as well as slides, photographs and audiovisual items (videocassettes, optical discs). Professional files reflect Burrell's specialization in advertising to African American and other minority consumer groups and the firm's approach to multicultural marketing. Materials also relate to Burrell's student years as well as notes and drafts of his book, Brainwashed: Challenging the Myth of Black Inferiority and Burrell's nonprofit organization The Resolutions Project. Companies represented include Bell Atlantic, Brown-Forman (Bacardi, Canadian Mist, Jack Daniels), Coca-Cola (including Sprite), K-Mart, McDonald's, Mobil, Philip Morris (Marlboro), Polaroid, Procter & Gamble (Tide, Gain, Crest, others) and Sears. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
